comments.body:
For rkt, if selinux is enabled, but selinux context is not set in the pod security context,
it uses what's in the `/etc/selinux/(policy)/contexts/lxc_contexts` as mentioned [here](https://coreos.com/rkt/docs/latest/selinux.html)

If selinux context is set, then it uses the selinux, by setting the [SELinuxContext](https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.exec.html) field in the [systemd unit file](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/v1.5.0-alpha.0/pkg/kubelet/rkt/rkt.go#L1164-L1172) that executes the `rkt run pod` command.

And the mounts are given unique mcs labels for each pod.
Thanks for the information -- I'll roll that back into the proposal.
